intro: Antimima loganii, commonly known as the Logan's antelopebush, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green fruits that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
